result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl L. Heard Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darryl L. Heard Sr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Darryl L. Heard Sr. was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Darryl L. Heard Sr. was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Darryl L. Heard Sr. was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Verifiable employment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Bond from 13cf1076 shall be applied.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $300 plus surcharges.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Sandra Webel, unless otherwise permitted by the agents discretion.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain a stable residence.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.
Costs still due and owing.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Darryl L. Heard, appeared with Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and sentencing arguments are made.  Counts 2, 4 and 5 - Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  Each count is concurrent and concurrent  with 13CF1076.  Restitution ordered in the amount of $300.00 as stipulated to by parties.  No contact with Sandra W. unless permitted by the Agent.  Remaining balance of bond in 13CF1076 is to be applied to this file and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
